subject: Technology
title: WhatsApp: Replacing the Phone Call
description: A short lesson to help you apply WhatsApp: Replacing the Phone Call.

hook.text: International phone calls once cost dollars per minute. Two former Yahoo employees thought that was absurd.

buildup.text: WhatsApp let you send messages over the internet instead of SMS. It was free with just a Wi-Fi connection.

discovery.text: In countries where SMS was expensive, WhatsApp grew explosively. It became the default way to communicate.

twist.text: Facebook bought WhatsApp for $19 billion. The founders later quit over privacy disagreements.

climax.text: WhatsApp now has over 2 billion users. In many countries, it is more important than email or phone calls.

punchline.text: Free messaging killed the international phone call.

quiz.question: How much did Facebook pay for WhatsApp?
